intro: Ageratina collodes, commonly known as the white mistflower, is a herbaceous plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant features fine, hairy leaves and produces small, white to pale blue flowers that bloom in clusters. Ageratina collodes thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded or partially shaded environments. Its botanical structure supports its role in local ecosystems, providing habitat and nectar for pollinators.
